cvss.description: Comprehensive machine-usable CVSS dataset for v2.0, v3.0, v3.1, and v4.0. All metrics include official numeric values, ranges, descriptions, and formulas from FIRST.org specifications. Supports customization through weight/formula overrides.

versions.notes: Original CVSS version with Base/Temporal/Environmental groups. Formula-based scoring. All values from FIRST CVSS v2 Complete Documentation.

base.description: Intrinsic characteristics of a vulnerability that are constant over time and across user environments.

AV.name: Access Vector
AV.description: Reflects how the vulnerability is exploited; measures the remoteness of the attack.

values.label: Local
values.description: Vulnerability requires local access or execution. Attacker must have physical or logical access to the vulnerable system.

values.label: Adjacent Network
values.description: Vulnerability requires access to local network segment. Examples include Bluetooth, local Ethernet, or shared subnet.

values.label: Network
values.description: Vulnerability is remotely exploitable from across network boundaries. Typical example is remote exploitation over the Internet.

AC.name: Access Complexity
AC.description: Measures the complexity of the attack required to exploit the vulnerability once an attacker has gained access to the target system.

values.label: High
values.description: Specialized access conditions exist. Attack requires considerable preparation or specialized circumstances that may not occur frequently.

values.label: Medium
values.description: Some specialized access conditions or extenuating circumstances exist. Exploitation requires some preparation.

values.label: Low
values.description: No special access conditions or extenuating circumstances exist. Attacker can expect repeatable exploit success.

Au.name: Authentication
Au.description: Measures the number of times an attacker must authenticate to a target in order to exploit the vulnerability.

values.label: Multiple
values.description: Exploiting the vulnerability requires that the attacker authenticate two or more times, even if the same credentials are used each time.

values.label: Single
values.description: Vulnerability requires an attacker to be logged into the system (such as at a command line or via a desktop session or web interface).

values.label: None
values.description: Authentication is not required to exploit the vulnerability.

C.name: Confidentiality Impact
C.description: Measures the impact on confidentiality of a successfully exploited vulnerability. Confidentiality refers to limiting information access and disclosure to only authorized users.

values.label: None
values.description: There is no impact to the confidentiality of the system.

values.label: Partial
values.description: There is considerable informational disclosure. Access to some system files is possible, but the attacker does not have control over what is obtained.

values.label: Complete
values.description: There is total information disclosure, resulting in all system files being revealed. The attacker is able to read all of the system's data.

I.name: Integrity Impact
I.description: Measures the impact to integrity of a successfully exploited vulnerability. Integrity refers to the trustworthiness and guaranteed veracity of information.

values.label: None
values.description: There is no impact to the integrity of the system.

values.label: Partial
values.description: Modification of some system files or information is possible, but the attacker does not have control over what can be modified.

values.label: Complete
values.description: There is total compromise of system integrity. The attacker is able to modify any files on the target system.

A.name: Availability Impact
A.description: Measures the impact to availability of a successfully exploited vulnerability. Availability refers to the accessibility of information resources.

values.label: None
values.description: There is no impact to the availability of the system.

values.label: Partial
values.description: There is reduced performance or interruptions in resource availability. Examples include network flooding attacks.

values.label: Complete
values.description: There is total shutdown of the affected resource. The attacker can render the resource completely unavailable.

temporal.description: Characteristics that change over time but not across user environments. These metrics measure the current state of exploit techniques or code availability.

E.name: Exploitability
E.description: Measures the current state of exploit techniques or code availability. The more easily a vulnerability can be exploited, the higher the vulnerability score.

values.label: Unproven
values.description: No exploit code is available, or an exploit is entirely theoretical.

values.label: Proof-of-Concept
values.description: Proof-of-concept exploit code or an attack demonstration that is not practical for most systems is available.

values.label: Functional
values.description: Functional exploit code is available. The code works in most situations where the vulnerability exists.

values.label: High
values.description: Either the vulnerability is exploitable by functional mobile autonomous code, or no exploit is required (manual trigger) and details are widely available.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Assigning this value to the metric will not influence the score. It is a signal to the equation to skip this metric.

RL.name: Remediation Level
RL.description: The remediation level of a vulnerability is an important factor for prioritization. The more officially a fix is available, the lower the vulnerability score.

values.label: Official Fix
values.description: A complete vendor solution is available. Either the vendor has issued an official patch or an upgrade is available.

values.label: Temporary Fix
values.description: There is an official but temporary fix available. This includes instances where the vendor issues a temporary hotfix, tool, or workaround.

values.label: Workaround
values.description: There is an unofficial, non-vendor solution available. In some cases, users may have created their own workaround.

values.label: Unavailable
values.description: There is either no solution available or it is impossible to apply a fix.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Assigning this value to the metric will not influence the score.

RC.name: Report Confidence
RC.description: Measures the degree of confidence in the existence of the vulnerability and the credibility of the known technical details.

values.label: Unconfirmed
values.description: There is a single unconfirmed source or possibly multiple conflicting reports. There is little confidence in the validity of the reports.

values.label: Uncorroborated
values.description: There are multiple non-official sources, possibly including independent security companies or research organizations. At this point there may be conflicting technical details.

values.label: Confirmed
values.description: The vulnerability has been acknowledged by the vendor or author of the affected technology. The vulnerability may also be 'Confirmed' when its existence is confirmed from an external event.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Assigning this value to the metric will not influence the score.

environmental.description: Represents the characteristics of a vulnerability that are relevant and unique to a particular user's environment.

CDP.name: Collateral Damage Potential
CDP.description: Measures the potential for loss of life or physical assets through damage or theft of property or equipment. The metric may also measure economic loss of productivity or revenue.

values.label: None
values.description: There is no potential for loss of life, physical assets, productivity or revenue.

values.label: Low
values.description: A successful exploit of this vulnerability may result in slight physical or property damage. Or there may be a slight loss of revenue or productivity to the organization.

values.label: Low-Medium
values.description: A successful exploit of this vulnerability may result in moderate physical or property damage. Or there may be a moderate loss of revenue or productivity to the organization.

values.label: Medium-High
values.description: A successful exploit of this vulnerability may result in significant physical or property damage or loss. Or there may be a significant loss of revenue or productivity.

values.label: High
values.description: A successful exploit of this vulnerability may result in catastrophic physical or property damage and loss. Or there may be a catastrophic loss of revenue or productivity.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Assigning this value to the metric will not influence the score.

TD.name: Target Distribution
TD.description: Measures the proportion of vulnerable systems within the user's environment. The greater the proportion of vulnerable systems, the higher the score.

values.label: None
values.description: No target systems exist, or targets are so highly specialized that they only exist in a laboratory setting.

values.label: Low
values.description: Targets exist inside the environment, but on a small scale. Between 1% - 25% of the total environment is at risk.

values.label: Medium
values.description: Targets exist inside the environment, but on a medium scale. Between 26% - 75% of the total environment is at risk.

values.label: High
values.description: Targets exist inside the environment on a considerable scale. Between 76% - 100% of the total environment is considered at risk.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Assigning this value to the metric will not influence the score. The default assumes a widespread target distribution.

CR.name: Confidentiality Requirement
CR.description: Measures the importance of the confidentiality of the system to the user's organization. Enables the analyst to customize the CVSS score depending on the importance of the affected IT asset.

values.label: Low
values.description: Loss of confidentiality is likely to have only a limited adverse effect on the organization or individuals associated with the organization.

values.label: Medium
values.description: Loss of confidentiality is likely to have a serious adverse effect on the organization or individuals.

values.label: High
values.description: Loss of confidentiality is likely to have a catastrophic adverse effect on the organization or individuals.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Assigning this value to the metric will not influence the score. The default is Medium.

IR.name: Integrity Requirement
IR.description: Measures the importance of the integrity of the system to the user's organization.

values.label: Low
values.description: Loss of integrity is likely to have only a limited adverse effect on the organization or individuals.

values.label: Medium
values.description: Loss of integrity is likely to have a serious adverse effect on the organization or individuals.

values.label: High
values.description: Loss of integrity is likely to have a catastrophic adverse effect on the organization or individuals.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Assigning this value to the metric will not influence the score. The default is Medium.

AR.name: Availability Requirement
AR.description: Measures the importance of the availability of the system to the user's organization.

values.label: Low
values.description: Loss of availability is likely to have only a limited adverse effect on the organization or individuals.

values.label: Medium
values.description: Loss of availability is likely to have a serious adverse effect on the organization or individuals.

values.label: High
values.description: Loss of availability is likely to have a catastrophic adverse effect on the organization or individuals.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Assigning this value to the metric will not influence the score. The default is Medium.

formulas.adjusted_impact: AdjustedImpact = min(10, 10.41 × (1 − (1 − C × CR) × (1 − I × IR) × (1 − A × AR)))

severity_scale.label: Low
severity_scale.description: Vulnerabilities with low severity typically have limited impact.

severity_scale.label: Medium
severity_scale.description: Vulnerabilities with medium severity should be addressed but are not critical.

severity_scale.label: High
severity_scale.description: Vulnerabilities with high severity should be prioritized for remediation.

versions.notes: Major revision introducing Scope metric and refined metric names. Formula-based scoring with scope multiplier (1.08). Superseded by v3.1.

base.description: Intrinsic characteristics that are constant over time and across user environments.

AV.name: Attack Vector
AV.description: Reflects the context by which vulnerability exploitation is possible.

values.label: Network
values.description: Vulnerable component is bound to the network stack; attacker can exploit remotely.

values.label: Adjacent
values.description: Attack is limited to the same shared physical or logical network.

values.label: Local
values.description: Attacker must have local access or user-level permissions.

values.label: Physical
values.description: Attack requires physical access to the vulnerable component.

AC.name: Attack Complexity
AC.description: Conditions beyond the attacker's control that must exist to exploit the vulnerability.

values.label: Low
values.description: No specialized conditions exist; attacker can expect repeatable success.

values.label: High
values.description: Successful attack depends on conditions beyond attacker's control.

PR.name: Privileges Required
PR.description: Level of privileges an attacker must possess before exploiting the vulnerability.

values.label: None
values.description: Attacker is unauthorized prior to attack; no access required.

values.label: Low
values.description: Attacker requires basic user capabilities.

values.label: High
values.description: Attacker requires significant control over the component.

UI.name: User Interaction
UI.description: Whether successful exploitation requires a user to take some action.

values.label: None
values.description: Vulnerable system can be exploited without user interaction.

values.label: Required
values.description: Successful exploitation requires user to take action (e.g., open malicious file).

S.name: Scope
S.description: Whether a vulnerability in one component impacts resources beyond its security scope.

values.label: Unchanged
values.description: Exploited vulnerability can only affect resources managed by the same authority.

values.label: Changed
values.description: Exploited vulnerability can affect resources beyond the security scope.

C.name: Confidentiality
C.description: Impact to confidentiality of information resources.

values.label: None
values.description: No loss of confidentiality.

values.label: Low
values.description: Some loss of confidentiality; limited information disclosure.

values.label: High
values.description: Total loss of confidentiality; all resources divulged.

I.name: Integrity
I.description: Impact to integrity of a successfully exploited vulnerability.

values.label: None
values.description: No loss of integrity.

values.label: Low
values.description: Modification of data possible but attacker lacks control.

values.label: High
values.description: Total loss of integrity; attacker can modify any/all files.

A.name: Availability
A.description: Impact to availability of the impacted component.

values.label: None
values.description: No impact to availability.

values.label: Low
values.description: Performance reduced or interruptions in resource availability.

values.label: High
values.description: Total loss of availability; attacker can deny access to resources.

temporal.description: Characteristics that change over time but not across user environments.

E.name: Exploit Code Maturity
E.description: Measures the likelihood of vulnerability being attacked based on current exploit techniques/code availability.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Assigning this value has no impact on the score.

values.label: High
values.description: Functional autonomous code exists or no exploit required.

values.label: Functional
values.description: Functional exploit code is available.

values.label: Proof-of-Concept
values.description: Proof-of-concept exploit code is available.

values.label: Unproven
values.description: No exploit code is available or theoretical.

RL.name: Remediation Level
RL.description: Availability of a fix for the vulnerability.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Assigning this value has no impact on the score.

values.label: Unavailable
values.description: No solution available or impossible to apply.

values.label: Workaround
values.description: Unofficial, non-vendor solution available.

values.label: Temporary Fix
values.description: Official but temporary fix available.

values.label: Official Fix
values.description: Complete vendor solution is available.

RC.name: Report Confidence
RC.description: Confidence in the existence of the vulnerability and credibility of technical details.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Assigning this value has no impact on the score.

values.label: Confirmed
values.description: Detailed reports exist or functional reproduction possible.

values.label: Reasonable
values.description: Significant details published but may lack full confidence.

values.label: Unknown
values.description: Reports exist but details unconfirmed.

environmental.description: Characteristics relevant and unique to a user's environment.
environmental.notes: Modified Base metrics (MAV, MAC, MPR, MUI, MS, MC, MI, MA) and Security Requirements (CR, IR, AR) allow customization.

CR.name: Confidentiality Requirement
CR.description: Importance of confidentiality to the organization.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Default; no impact on score.

values.label: High
values.description: Loss has catastrophic adverse effect.

values.label: Medium
values.description: Loss has serious adverse effect.

values.label: Low
values.description: Loss has limited adverse effect.

IR.name: Integrity Requirement
IR.description: Importance of integrity to the organization.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Default; no impact on score.

values.label: High
values.description: Loss has catastrophic adverse effect.

values.label: Medium
values.description: Loss has serious adverse effect.

values.label: Low
values.description: Loss has limited adverse effect.

AR.name: Availability Requirement
AR.description: Importance of availability to the organization.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Default; no impact on score.

values.label: High
values.description: Loss has catastrophic adverse effect.

values.label: Medium
values.description: Loss has serious adverse effect.

values.label: Low
values.description: Loss has limited adverse effect.

environmental.modified_base_metrics_note: All Base metrics can be modified with 'M' prefix (MAV, MAC, MPR, MUI, MS, MC, MI, MA). Modified metrics use same values as Base metrics plus 'X' (Not Defined) to use original Base value.

formulas.environmental_note: Environmental score uses Modified Base metrics to calculate Modified Impact and Modified Exploitability, then applies Temporal multipliers and Security Requirements.

severity_scale.label: Critical
severity_scale.description: Critical severity; severe or catastrophic impact.

versions.notes: Minor refinement of v3.0 with clarifications and formula adjustment (exponent changed from 15 to 13 for environmental impact). Numeric values from FIRST v3.1 Table 16. No new metrics or values introduced.

base.description: Intrinsic characteristics of a vulnerability that are constant over time and across user environments.

AV.name: Attack Vector
AV.description: Reflects the context by which vulnerability exploitation is possible. Measures the remoteness of the attacker relative to the vulnerable component.

values.label: Network
values.description: Vulnerable component is bound to the network stack and the set of possible attackers extends beyond the other options, up to and including the entire Internet. Exploitation remotely across network boundaries.

values.label: Adjacent
values.description: Vulnerable component is bound to the network stack, but attack is limited at protocol level to logically adjacent topology. Examples: Bluetooth, IEEE 802.11, local IP subnet.

values.label: Local
values.description: Vulnerable component is not bound to the network stack; attacker's path is via read/write/execute capabilities. Local access required (shell access, SSH) or requires user execution.

values.label: Physical
values.description: Attack requires physical access or manipulation of the vulnerable component. Physical interaction required (e.g., cold boot attacks, peripheral attacks).

AC.name: Attack Complexity
AC.description: Conditions beyond the attacker's control that must exist in order to exploit the vulnerability. Measures the ease or difficulty of exploiting the vulnerability.

values.label: Low
values.description: Specialized access conditions or extenuating circumstances do not exist. Attacker can expect repeatable exploit success against the vulnerable component.

values.label: High
values.description: Successful attack depends on conditions beyond attacker's control. Requires considerable preparation or execution against specific target. Examples: race condition, social engineering.

PR.name: Privileges Required
PR.description: Level of privileges an attacker must possess before successfully exploiting the vulnerability. Measures authentication requirements.

values.label: None
values.description: Attacker is unauthorized prior to attack and requires no access to settings or files to carry out an attack.

values.label: Low
values.description: Attacker requires privileges that provide basic user capabilities that could normally affect only settings and files owned by a single user. Non-privileged user account.
values.note: Score depends on Scope: 0.62 if Unchanged, 0.68 if Changed

values.label: High
values.description: Attacker requires privileges that provide significant (e.g., administrative) control over the vulnerable component allowing access to component-wide settings and files.
values.note: Score depends on Scope: 0.27 if Unchanged, 0.5 if Changed

UI.name: User Interaction
UI.description: Captures the requirement for a human user, other than the attacker, to participate in the successful compromise of the vulnerable component.

values.label: None
values.description: Vulnerable system can be exploited without interaction from any user. Attack can proceed at will.

values.label: Required
values.description: Successful exploitation requires a user to take some action before vulnerability can be exploited. Examples: opening email attachment, visiting malicious webpage, performing specific action.

S.name: Scope
S.description: Whether a vulnerability in one vulnerable component impacts resources in components beyond its security scope. Represents authorization boundaries crossed.

values.label: Unchanged
values.description: Exploited vulnerability can only affect resources managed by the same security authority. Impact confined to the vulnerable component.

values.label: Changed
values.description: Exploited vulnerability can affect resources beyond the security scope managed by the security authority of the vulnerable component. Impacts resources beyond the vulnerable component.

C.name: Confidentiality
C.description: Impact to the confidentiality of the information resources managed by a software component. Measures information disclosure.

values.label: High
values.description: Total loss of confidentiality; all resources within the impacted component are divulged to the attacker. Attacker can read all system data.

values.label: Low
values.description: Some loss of confidentiality. Access to some restricted information is obtained, but attacker does not have control over what information is obtained. Partial disclosure.

values.label: None
values.description: No loss of confidentiality within the impacted component.

I.name: Integrity
I.description: Impact to integrity of a successfully exploited vulnerability. Integrity refers to trustworthiness and veracity of information.

values.label: High
values.description: Total loss of integrity or complete loss of protection. Attacker is able to modify any or all files protected by the impacted component.

values.label: Low
values.description: Modification of data is possible, but attacker does not have control over the consequence of a modification or amount of modification is limited.

values.label: None
values.description: No loss of integrity within the impacted component.

A.name: Availability
A.description: Impact to the availability of the impacted component resulting from successfully exploited vulnerability. Availability refers to accessibility of information resources.

values.label: High
values.description: Total loss of availability resulting in attacker being able to fully deny access to resources in the impacted component. This loss is sustained or persistent.

values.label: Low
values.description: Performance is reduced or there are interruptions in resource availability. Attacker does not have ability to completely deny service.

values.label: None
values.description: No impact to availability within the impacted component.

temporal.description: Characteristics that measure the current state of exploit techniques, code availability, and the existence of patches or workarounds.

E.name: Exploit Code Maturity
E.description: Measures the likelihood of the vulnerability being attacked and is typically based on the current state of exploit techniques, exploit code availability, or active exploitation.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Assigning this value indicates there is insufficient information to choose one of the other values and has no impact on overall score. Defaults to worst case (High).

values.label: High
values.description: Functional autonomous code exists or no exploit is required (manual trigger) and details are widely available. Includes mobile or autonomous code such as viruses or worms.

values.label: Functional
values.description: Functional exploit code is available. The code works in most situations where the vulnerability exists.

values.label: Proof-of-Concept
values.description: Proof-of-concept exploit code is available or an attack demonstration is not practical for most systems. Code or technique is not functional in all situations.

values.label: Unproven
values.description: No exploit code is available or an exploit is theoretical.

RL.name: Remediation Level
RL.description: Remediation Level of a vulnerability is an important factor for prioritization. The typical vulnerability is unpatched when initially published.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Assigning this value has no impact on the score. Defaults to worst case (Unavailable).

values.label: Unavailable
values.description: There is either no solution available or it is impossible to apply a fix.

values.label: Workaround
values.description: There is an unofficial, non-vendor solution available. In some cases, users of the affected technology will create a patch themselves or provide steps to work around or otherwise mitigate the vulnerability.

values.label: Temporary Fix
values.description: There is an official but temporary fix available. This includes instances where the vendor issues a temporary hotfix, tool, or workaround.

values.label: Official Fix
values.description: A complete vendor solution is available. Either the vendor has issued an official patch or an upgrade is available.

RC.name: Report Confidence
RC.description: Measures the degree of confidence in the existence of the vulnerability and the credibility of the known technical details.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Assigning this value has no impact on the score. Defaults to worst case (Confirmed).

values.label: Confirmed
values.description: Detailed reports exist or functional reproduction is possible (functional exploits may provide this). Source code is available to independently verify assertions or author/vendor has confirmed the vulnerability.

values.label: Reasonable
values.description: Significant details are published but researchers either do not have full confidence in root cause or do not have access to source code to fully confirm all interactions.

values.label: Unknown
values.description: Reports exist indicating vulnerability is present but details are insufficient to conclude with confidence.

environmental.description: Represents the characteristics of a vulnerability that are relevant and unique to a particular user's environment. Allows customization of CVSS score based on importance of affected IT asset and modified base metrics.

CR.name: Confidentiality Requirement
CR.description: Enables the analyst to customize the CVSS score depending on the importance of the affected IT asset to a user's organization measured in terms of confidentiality.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Assigning this value has no impact on the score. Assumes Medium importance.

values.label: High
values.description: Loss of confidentiality is likely to have a catastrophic adverse effect on the organization or individuals associated with the organization.

values.label: Medium
values.description: Loss of confidentiality is likely to have a serious adverse effect on the organization or individuals.

values.label: Low
values.description: Loss of confidentiality is likely to have only a limited adverse effect on the organization or individuals.

IR.name: Integrity Requirement
IR.description: Enables the analyst to customize the CVSS score depending on the importance of the affected IT asset to a user's organization measured in terms of integrity.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Assigning this value has no impact on the score. Assumes Medium importance.

values.label: High
values.description: Loss of integrity is likely to have a catastrophic adverse effect on the organization or individuals.

values.label: Medium
values.description: Loss of integrity is likely to have a serious adverse effect on the organization or individuals.

values.label: Low
values.description: Loss of integrity is likely to have only a limited adverse effect on the organization or individuals.

AR.name: Availability Requirement
AR.description: Enables the analyst to customize the CVSS score depending on the importance of the affected IT asset to a user's organization measured in terms of availability.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Assigning this value has no impact on the score. Assumes Medium importance.

values.label: High
values.description: Loss of availability is likely to have a catastrophic adverse effect on the organization or individuals.

values.label: Medium
values.description: Loss of availability is likely to have a serious adverse effect on the organization or individuals.

values.label: Low
values.description: Loss of availability is likely to have only a limited adverse effect on the organization or individuals.

modified_base_metrics.description: These metrics enable the analyst to override individual Base metrics based on specific characteristics of a user's environment. Modified Base metrics use the same values as their corresponding Base metrics with the addition of 'X' (Not Defined) which uses the corresponding Base metric value.

metrics.name: Modified Attack Vector
metrics.description: Override for Attack Vector in user's environment
metrics.values_reference: Same as AV plus X (Not Defined)

metrics.name: Modified Attack Complexity
metrics.description: Override for Attack Complexity in user's environment
metrics.values_reference: Same as AC plus X (Not Defined)

metrics.name: Modified Privileges Required
metrics.description: Override for Privileges Required in user's environment
metrics.values_reference: Same as PR plus X (Not Defined)

metrics.name: Modified User Interaction
metrics.description: Override for User Interaction in user's environment
metrics.values_reference: Same as UI plus X (Not Defined)

metrics.name: Modified Scope
metrics.description: Override for Scope in user's environment
metrics.values_reference: Same as S plus X (Not Defined)

metrics.name: Modified Confidentiality
metrics.description: Override for Confidentiality impact in user's environment
metrics.values_reference: Same as C plus X (Not Defined)

metrics.name: Modified Integrity
metrics.description: Override for Integrity impact in user's environment
metrics.values_reference: Same as I plus X (Not Defined)

metrics.name: Modified Availability
metrics.description: Override for Availability impact in user's environment
metrics.values_reference: Same as A plus X (Not Defined)

scoring.description: CVSS v3.1 uses formula-based scoring with impact and exploitability sub-scores. Scope determines which formula variant to use.

formulas.base_score_scope_unchanged: If Scope = Unchanged: BaseScore = Roundup(Minimum[(Impact + Exploitability), 10])
formulas.base_score_scope_changed: If Scope = Changed: BaseScore = Roundup(Minimum[1.08 × (Impact + Exploitability), 10])
formulas.environmental_MISS: ModifiedImpactSubScore = Minimum(1 − [(1 − MC × CR) × (1 − MI × IR) × (1 − MA × AR)], 0.915)
formulas.environmental_score_unchanged: If ModifiedScope = Unchanged: EnvironmentalScore = Roundup(Roundup(Minimum[(ModifiedImpact + ModifiedExploitability), 10]) × ExploitCodeMaturity × RemediationLevel × ReportConfidence)
formulas.environmental_score_changed: If ModifiedScope = Changed: EnvironmentalScore = Roundup(Roundup(Minimum[1.08 × (ModifiedImpact + ModifiedExploitability), 10]) × ExploitCodeMaturity × RemediationLevel × ReportConfidence)

notes: Roundup function rounds up to 1 decimal place (ceiling function)
Minimum function ensures score does not exceed 10.0
Modified Base metrics default to their Base values when set to X (Not Defined)
The exponent 13 in the Scope Changed formula is specific to v3.1 (v3.0 used 15)
The 0.915 cap in ModifiedImpactSubScore prevents environmental scores from exceeding 10.0

severity_scale.label: None
severity_scale.description: No vulnerability or no impact. Score exactly 0.0.

severity_scale.label: Low
severity_scale.description: Low severity vulnerabilities typically have limited impact and may be lower priority for remediation.

severity_scale.label: Medium
severity_scale.description: Medium severity vulnerabilities represent a moderate risk and should be addressed in a reasonable timeframe.

severity_scale.label: High
severity_scale.description: High severity vulnerabilities represent significant risk and should be prioritized for remediation.

severity_scale.label: Critical
severity_scale.description: Critical severity vulnerabilities represent severe or catastrophic risk and should be remediated immediately.

vector_format.description: All 8 Base metrics are mandatory in vector string. Temporal and Environmental metrics are optional.
vector_format.ordering_note: Metrics must appear in specified order. Optional metrics may be omitted but cannot be reordered.

versions.notes: Major revision with MacroVector-based scoring replacing formula-based approach. Introduces Attack Requirements (AT), expanded User Interaction (adds Passive), separate impacts for Vulnerable and Subsequent Systems, and formal Supplemental metric group. Nomenclature (CVSS-B, CVSS-BT, CVSS-BE, CVSS-BTE) indicates metric groups used.

base.description: Intrinsic characteristics that produce the CVSS-B (Base) score. Mandatory for all vulnerability assessments.

AV.name: Attack Vector
AV.description: Context by which vulnerability can be exploited; captures remoteness of attacker from vulnerable component.

values.label: Network
values.description: Attacker is remotely exploitable across networks (Internet, WAN); vulnerable component attached to network stack. Largest attack surface.

values.label: Adjacent
values.description: Attack limited to shared physical (Bluetooth) or logical (local IP subnet, VPN) network. Includes attacks requiring local network position.

values.label: Local
values.description: Attacker requires local access/execution (shell, SSH, terminal) or relies on user execution. Not remotely exploitable.

values.label: Physical
values.description: Requires physical touch or manipulation of vulnerable device. Smallest attack surface.

AC.name: Attack Complexity
AC.description: Measures evasion or circumvention of existing built-in security-enhancing defenses to execute attack.

values.label: Low
values.description: No target-specific circumvention technique needed. Attacker can expect repeatable success. No specialized preparation required.

values.label: High
values.description: Requires evasion of exploit mitigation techniques (ASLR, DEP) or obtaining target-specific secrets. Success may vary across attempts.

AT.name: Attack Requirements
AT.description: Prerequisite deployment and execution conditions or variables of the vulnerable system that enable the attack. NEW in v4.0.

values.label: None
values.description: Successful attack is not contingent on any deployment/execution conditions. Attack succeeds independently.

values.label: Present
values.description: Requires specific deployment/execution conditions. Examples: race condition requiring multiple attempts, network injection requiring specific timing.

PR.name: Privileges Required
PR.description: Level of privileges attacker must possess before successfully exploiting the vulnerability.

values.label: None
values.description: Unauthenticated; attacker requires no prior access to settings or files. Fully unprivileged.

values.label: Low
values.description: Basic capabilities that affect only non-sensitive resources. Examples: standard user account, limited permissions.

values.label: High
values.description: Significant (e.g., administrative) control over component allowing access to component-wide settings/files.

UI.name: User Interaction
UI.description: Requirement for user (other than attacker) to participate in successful compromise. EXPANDED in v4.0 with Passive option.

values.label: None
values.description: Attacker can exploit without any user interaction. Attack proceeds at will.

values.label: Passive
values.description: Requires limited unconscious/involuntary interaction. Examples: browsing to website, viewing document in default settings. NEW in v4.0.

values.label: Active
values.description: Requires user to perform specific conscious action. Examples: accepting prompt, reconfiguring settings, clicking beyond alerts.

vulnerable_system.description: Impact on the vulnerable system component that contains the exploited vulnerability.

VC.name: Confidentiality (Vulnerable System)
VC.description: Impact to confidentiality of information managed by the vulnerable system component.

values.label: High
values.description: Total information disclosure; attacker can read all system information. Or disclosure of serious restricted information (e.g., passwords, keys).

values.label: Low
values.description: Some loss of confidentiality. Limited information disclosed without attacker control over what is obtained.

values.label: None
values.description: No impact to confidentiality of the vulnerable system.

VI.name: Integrity (Vulnerable System)
VI.description: Impact to integrity of the vulnerable system component.

values.label: High
values.description: Total integrity loss; attacker can modify any/all files. Or modification of critical/serious information (security files, configuration, code).

values.label: Low
values.description: Limited integrity modification possible without attacker control over consequence. Non-serious information modified.

values.label: None
values.description: No impact to integrity of the vulnerable system.

VA.name: Availability (Vulnerable System)
VA.description: Impact to availability of the vulnerable system component.

values.label: High
values.description: Total loss of availability; attacker can fully deny access. Sustained or persistent DoS.

values.label: Low
values.description: Reduced performance or intermittent/temporary loss of availability. Partial DoS.

values.label: None
values.description: No impact to availability of the vulnerable system.

subsequent_system.description: Impact on systems or components beyond the vulnerable component itself. Captures scope-change impact more precisely than v3.x Scope metric.

SC.name: Confidentiality (Subsequent System)
SC.description: Impact to confidentiality of subsequent systems beyond the vulnerable component.

values.label: High
values.description: Total information disclosure on subsequent system(s). Or disclosure of serious information from subsequent systems.

values.label: Low
values.description: Some loss of confidentiality on subsequent system(s). Limited subsequent system information disclosed.

values.label: None
values.description: No impact to confidentiality beyond the vulnerable system. Impacts contained to vulnerable component only.

SI.name: Integrity (Subsequent System)
SI.description: Impact to integrity of subsequent systems beyond the vulnerable component.

values.label: High
values.description: Total integrity loss on subsequent system(s). Or modification of critical/serious subsequent system data.

values.label: Low
values.description: Limited integrity modification on subsequent system(s) without attacker control. Non-serious subsequent information modified.

values.label: None
values.description: No impact to integrity beyond the vulnerable system. Impacts contained to vulnerable component only.

SA.name: Availability (Subsequent System)
SA.description: Impact to availability of subsequent systems beyond the vulnerable component.

values.label: High
values.description: Total loss of availability on subsequent system(s). Attacker can fully deny access to subsequent systems.

values.label: Low
values.description: Reduced performance or intermittent loss on subsequent system(s). Partial subsequent system DoS.

values.label: None
values.description: No impact to availability beyond the vulnerable system. Impacts contained to vulnerable component only.

threat.description: Measures current state of exploitation. Produces CVSS-BT (Base+Threat) score when combined with Base.

E.name: Exploit Maturity
E.description: Current technical state of exploitation. Readiness and availability of attack tools/code.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Metric not evaluated due to insufficient information. Assumes worst case (Attacked).

values.label: Attacked
values.description: Documented real-world attacks or attacker-controlled exploit toolkits/frameworks available. Actively being exploited.

values.label: Proof-of-Concept
values.description: Public PoC code/detailed technical article available but no known attacks or simplified exploitation tools.

values.label: Unreported
values.description: No public PoC, no known exploitation activity, and no attack tools available. Exploitation unreported.

environmental.description: Customization for user's specific environment. Produces CVSS-BE (Base+Environmental) or CVSS-BTE (Base+Threat+Environmental) scores.

security_requirements.description: Importance of confidentiality, integrity, and availability to the user's organization.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Metric not evaluated. Assumes High (worst case) for scoring.

values.label: High
values.description: Loss causes catastrophic organizational/individual adverse effect (per IEC 61508 marginal+ injury severity).

values.label: Medium
values.description: Loss causes serious adverse effect.

values.label: Low
values.description: Loss causes limited adverse effect.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Metric not evaluated. Assumes High (worst case) for scoring.

values.label: High
values.description: Loss causes catastrophic organizational/individual adverse effect.

values.label: Medium
values.description: Loss causes serious adverse effect.

values.label: Low
values.description: Loss causes limited adverse effect.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Metric not evaluated. Assumes High (worst case) for scoring.

values.label: High
values.description: Loss causes catastrophic organizational/individual adverse effect.

values.label: Medium
values.description: Loss causes serious adverse effect.

values.label: Low
values.description: Loss causes limited adverse effect.

modified_base_metrics.description: Override Base metrics to reflect characteristics of user's deployed environment. All modified metrics accept same values as Base equivalents plus X (Not Defined) to use Base value.

metrics.name: Modified Confidentiality (Subsequent System)
metrics.values_reference: Same as SC plus X and S

metrics.name: Modified Integrity (Subsequent System)
metrics.values_reference: Same as SI plus X and S

metrics.name: Modified Availability (Subsequent System)
metrics.values_reference: Same as SA plus X and S

modified_base_metrics.special_value_note: MSI and MSA accept special value 'S' (Safety) to indicate IEC 61508 marginal/critical/catastrophic injury risk.

supplemental.description: Provide additional context for vulnerability consumers but DO NOT affect numerical score. Informational only. NEW in v4.0.

S.name: Safety
S.description: Predictability of physical harm or human safety impact if exploited.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Not evaluated or unknown safety impact.

values.label: Present
values.description: Consequences match IEC 61508 marginal, critical, or catastrophic injury severity levels.

values.label: Negligible
values.description: Consequences match only IEC 61508 negligible injury severity.

AU.name: Automatable
AU.description: Can attacker reliably automate all steps of kill chain (reconnaissance through exploitation) across multiple targets?

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Not evaluated or unknown.

values.label: Yes
values.description: Attacker can automate all attack steps. 'Wormable' vulnerability.

values.label: No
values.description: Attacker cannot reliably automate exploitation across targets. Requires per-target customization.

R.name: Recovery
R.description: Resilience of vulnerable system to recover functionality and availability post-attack.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Not evaluated or unknown.

values.label: Automatic
values.description: Component automatically recovers services without administrator intervention.

values.label: User
values.description: Administrator must manually intervene to restore services.

values.label: Irrecoverable
values.description: Services permanently lost to user; not recoverable (e.g., non-recoverable corruption).

V.name: Value Density
V.description: Resources attacker gains per successful exploitation event.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Not evaluated or unknown.

values.label: Diffuse
values.description: Limited resources gained per exploitation. Single-user system impact (e.g., email client, individual workstation).

values.label: Concentrated
values.description: Rich resources per exploitation. System operator responsibility (e.g., database server, central repository).

RE.name: Vulnerability Response Effort
RE.description: Effort level required by vulnerability consumer to respond (patch, mitigate, investigate).

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Not evaluated or unknown.

values.label: Low
values.description: Trivial response; documentation/workaround only or no immediate action needed.

values.label: Moderate
values.description: Some effort; simple update/configuration with minimal service impact.

values.label: High
values.description: Significant effort; complex deployment, extended service impact, or physical replacement required.

U.name: Provider Urgency
U.description: Urgency assessment by vulnerability provider/vendor. Provider's recommended priority level.

values.label: Not Defined
values.description: Not evaluated or provider has not assigned urgency.

values.label: Clear
values.description: No urgency; informational only.

values.label: Green
values.description: Reduced urgency; lower priority.

values.label: Amber
values.description: Moderate urgency; medium priority.

values.label: Red
values.description: Highest urgency; immediate action recommended.

scoring.description: CVSS v4.0 uses MacroVector equivalence classes instead of formulas. Vectors are grouped by similar qualitative severity; scoring uses lookup tables and interpolation.

macrovector_explanation.equivalence_groups: Six Equivalence Groups (EQ1-EQ6) cluster metrics by severity. Each EQ has values 0 (most severe) to 2 (least severe).
macrovector_explanation.highest_severity_vector: Defined maximum-severity vector for each MacroVector combination per official lookup tables.
macrovector_explanation.lowest_severity_vector: Defined minimum-severity vector for each MacroVector combination per official lookup tables.
macrovector_explanation.depth: Maximum severity distance between highest and lowest vectors in equivalence class.
macrovector_explanation.lookup_table_location: Complete MacroVector scores in cvss_lookup.js from FIRST CVSS v4.0 calculator repository (GitHub: first-org/cvss-v4-calculator).

scoring_steps: 1. Map Base + Threat + Environmental metrics to MacroVector equivalence class (EQ1-EQ6 values)
2. Lookup base severity score for MacroVector from official lookup table
3. Calculate distance from next lower MacroVector severity level
4. Interpolate score proportional to distance (averaged across EQ groups)
5. Apply Security Requirements (CR/IR/AR) adjustments if Environmental metrics present
notes: MacroVector approach ensures metric changes produce commensurate score changes within expert judgment uncertainty
Supplemental metrics DO NOT affect numerical score; used for policy/prioritization decisions
Environmental score incorporates modified Base metrics and Security Requirements
Threat score reflects current exploitation maturity state

severity_scale.label: None
severity_scale.description: No vulnerability or no impact. Score exactly 0.0.

severity_scale.label: Low
severity_scale.description: Low severity; limited impact or low exploitability.

severity_scale.label: Medium
severity_scale.description: Medium severity; moderate risk requiring attention in reasonable timeframe.

severity_scale.label: High
severity_scale.description: High severity; significant risk requiring prioritized remediation.

severity_scale.label: Critical
severity_scale.description: Critical severity; severe or catastrophic risk requiring immediate remediation.

vector_format.ordering_rules: Metrics must appear in specified order. Optional metrics may be omitted but cannot be reordered. Base metrics are mandatory.
vector_format.not_defined_handling: Optional metrics default to 'X' (Not Defined) when omitted from vector string.

override_example.purpose: Demonstrates how to customize a metric weight for organizational needs
override_example.scenario: Organization wants to increase weight of Privileges Required for Low privilege level

L.justification: Organization policy: Low-privilege accounts have greater access than typical environments

formula_override_example.scenario: Research team testing alternative environmental impact exponent
formula_override_example.formula_override: Use exponent 12 instead of 13 for Modified Impact calculation
formula_override_example.warning: Formula overrides should only be used for research or specialized environments with documented justification

implementation_notes.rounding: All CVSS scores use 'Roundup' function (ceiling to 1 decimal place) except where explicitly noted
implementation_notes.vector_parsing: Parsers must enforce metric ordering and reject out-of-order metrics
implementation_notes.not_defined_semantics: X (Not Defined) or omitted optional metrics assume worst-case values for scoring
implementation_notes.backward_compatibility: v3.1 vectors are not compatible with v3.0 calculators due to formula differences (exponent 13 vs 15)
implementation_notes.version_identification: Always check vector prefix (CVSS:2.0, CVSS:3.0, CVSS:3.1, CVSS:4.0) to apply correct specification
